thread.title: Jaden Smith Is Leaving His Art on the Streets for Lucky Fans to Find
thread.title_full: Jaden Smith Is Leaving His Art on the Streets for Lucky Fans to Find

author: Graeme Campbell
title: Jaden Smith Is Leaving His Art on the Streets for Lucky Fans to Find
text:
Never done with shifting the paradigm, enlightened teen and Highsnobiety homie Jaden Smith has found a novel way of distributing his art by leaving it outside Los Angeles galleries for fans and pedestrians to collect.
Jaden has been sharing the locations of his abstract pieces via Twitter, including Basquiat-like canvas painting with text reading “Will you die with me?” Another piece was left in the Van Nuys neighborhood; it remains to be seen if it’s been claimed.
I Just Left My Art Piece Here, Come Get It. pic.twitter.com/Hqthfnc4iw 
— Jaden Smith (@officialjaden) February 23, 2017 

. @officialjaden THANK U pic.twitter.com/UOtVH3zw3K 
— Kevin Doan (@kevindoan_) February 23, 2017 

I left A Piece At Living Spaces In Van Nuys, I Hope You Enjoy It And Have A Good Day. pic.twitter.com/feovVGauZK 
— Jaden Smith (@officialjaden) February 24, 2017 

Jaden has been busy on the art scene of late, having lent his support to the politically-charged Beouf, Rönkkö & Turner project. As you can glean below, it’s a discipline the youngster holds dear.
.Make Art
— Jaden Smith (@officialjaden) February 1, 2017 

Make Art!
— Jaden Smith (@officialjaden) February 1, 2017 

Make. Art.
— Jaden Smith (@officialjaden) February 1, 2017 

Make Art…
— Jaden Smith (@officialjaden) February 1, 2017 

Keep your eyes peeled on Jaden’s timeline for further drops.
Elsewhere in the art world, we recently met VLONE collaborator Andrea “FACE” Facelli .
